it.polito.computervision.gestures.impl

Class ClickGesture

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polito.computervision.gestures.AbstractGesture
      • it.polito.computervision.gestures.OneHandGesture
        • it.polito.computervision.gestures.impl.ClickGesture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Gesture

    public class ClickGesture
extends OneHandGesture
    Detects a click. That is, a single hand touched the screen, then released touch. Custom data: - initialPosition: Point2D (the projected position where the hand touched the screen first)
    Author:
    Giovanni Piumatti

    • Method Detail

      • doUpdateState

        public GestureState doUpdateState(HandData currentlyTrackedHand,
                         boolean touchReleased)
        Concrete gestures must implement this method. The semantics are the same of Gesture.updateState(List,List). When a hand touches the screen, that becomes the currently tracked hand, and is passed to this method until either a AbstractGesture.reset() is called or the hand is lost (not tracked anymore).
        Specified by:
        doUpdateState in class OneHandGesture
        Parameters:
        currentlyTrackedHand - The HandData currently being tracked for this gesture, or null if no hand is being tracked yet
        touchReleased - true if the touch was released, false otherwise (i.e. there are more than 1 hand touching)
        Returns:
        The GestureState this gesture is in after the update.

      • doReset

        protected void doReset()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGesture
        Implementations should place their reset logic here
        Overrides:
        doReset in class OneHandGesture
